AttributeDefinition.description: Post Hospitalization Autocheck Health Status Prescription
Post Hospitalization Prescription Vital Signs Monitoring
Pre Hospitalization Anaemia Assessment And Management
Post Hospitalization Answer Autocheck Health Status
Post Hospitalization Patient Education And Training To The Caregiver

DerivedAttributeDefinition.expression: number(ch1,0) + number(ch2,0) + number(ch3,0) + number(ch4,0) + number(ch5,0) + number(ch6,0) + number(ch7,0) + number(ch8,0) + number(ch9,0) + number(ch10,0) + number(ch11,0)*2 + number(ch12,0)*2 + number(ch13,0)*2 + number(ch14,0)*2 + number(ch15,0)*2 + number(ch16,0)*2 + number(ch17,0)*3 + number(ch18,0)*6 + number(ch19,0)*6 + number(ch20,0)

AttributeDefinition.description: Has the patient more than 3 Chronic Diseases?
Does the patient take 4 or more pills or drugs per day?
How many times has the patient been admitted to hospital last year?
How many times has the patient been re-admitted to hospital from emergency last year?

EnumerationOption.description: ASA I: A normal healthy patient
ASA II: A patient with mild systemic disease
ASA III: A patient with severe systemic disease
ASA IV: A patient with severe systemic disease that is a constant threat to life
ASA V: A moribund patient who is not expected to survive without the operation
ASA VI: A declared brain-dead patient whose organs are being removed for donor purposes

AttributeDefinition.description: Vosté o el seu cuidador tenen connexió a internet?

EnumerationOption.description: Telèfon mòvil no tan sols per trucar.
Telèfon mòvil no tan sols per trucar.

AttributeDefinition.description: Accepta participar al procés clínic descrit al present document?
Height or distance between knee – ankle

EnumerationOption.description: Severe difficulty :: Difficulty in all situations
Moderate difficulty :: Problem hearing normal conversation, requires quiet setting to hear well
Minimal difficulty :: Difficulty in some environments | weaspering,
Adequate :: No difficulty in normal conversation, social interaction and TV

AttributeDefinition.description: Vision | with glasses or with other visual appliance normally used

EnumerationOption.description: Severe difficulty :: Sees only light, colors, shapes
Moderate difficulty :: Limited vision; not able to see newspaper headlines, but can identify objects
Minimal difficulty :: Sees large print, but not regular print in newspapers/books
Adequate ::Sees fine detail, including regular print in newspapers/books

AttributeDefinition.description: Ability to express oneself | Expressing information content both verbal and nonverbal

EnumerationOption.description: Sometimes understood :: Ability is limited to making concrete requests
Often understood :: Difficulty finding words or finishing thoughts AND prompting usually required
Usually understood :: Difficulty finding words or finishing thoughts BUT if given time, little or no prompting required

AttributeDefinition.description: Alcohol consumption - More than 2 standard drinks 10 gr alcohol / day?

EnumerationOption.description: Living at home with partial support
Living at home but in need of complete support
Poor (Poor: includes absence of elevator in the patient’s dwelling building in patients with bad functional status)
Poor (Poor: means unhealthy or untidy previously reported by social services)

AttributeDefinition.description: Unable for self-care reported by social services or unfavourable score in self-care test.
Caved or unable carer (reported by social services or by health care professionals)
The carer has a chronic disease as well.
Patient Perception of Adequacy of support

EnumerationOption.description: Weekly partial support or lives alone

AttributeDefinition.description: Has the treatment more than 4 tablets/day?
More than 4 different medication/day on regularly?
Is the treatment hard to prepare?
Is the treatment easy to run? Is able the patient to run it? (Inhalation technique mistakes are included).
Lives alone or spends alone most of the day?
Has the carer a chronic disease as well?
I still enjoy the things I used to enjoy:
I get a sort of frightened feeling as if something awful is about to happen:

EnumerationOption.description: A little, but it doesn't worry me

AttributeDefinition.description: I can laugh and see the funny side of things:

EnumerationOption.description: As much as I always could

AttributeDefinition.description: Worrying thoughts go through my mind:

EnumerationOption.description: From time to time, but not too often
A great deal of the time
From time to time, but not too often
A great deal of the time

AttributeDefinition.description: I can sit at ease and feel relaxed:
I feel as if I am slowed down:
I get a sort of frightened feeling like 'butterflies' in the stomach:
I have lost interest in my appearance:

EnumerationOption.description: I take just as much care as ever
I may not take quite as much care
I don't take as much care as I should

AttributeDefinition.description: I feel restless as I have to be on the move:
I look forward with enjoyment to things:

EnumerationOption.description: As much as I ever did
Rather less than I used to
Definitely less than I used to

AttributeDefinition.description: I get sudden feelings of panic
I can enjoy a good book or radio or TV program:

EnumerationOption.description: needs help cutting, spreading butter, etc., or requires modified diet
needs to help with personal care
needs help but can do about half unaided
incontinent (or needs to be given enemas)
incontinent, or catheterized and unable to manage alone
needs some help, but can do something alone
major help (one or two people, physical), can sit

AttributeDefinition.description: Stiffness - Stiffn ess occurring later in the day
1. In general, would you say your health is:

The following questions are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health now limit you in these activities? If so, how much? 2. Moderate activities such as moving a table, pushing a vacuum cleaner, bowling, or playing golf.
The following questions are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health now limit you in these activities? If so, how much? 3. Climbing several flights of stairs.
During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of your physical health? 4. Accomplished less than you would like.

During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of your physical health? 5. Were limited in the kind of work or other activities.

During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems (such as feeling depressed or anxious)? 6. Accomplished less than you would like.

During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems (such as feeling depressed or anxious)? 7. Did work or activities less carefully than usual.

During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems (such as feeling depressed or anxious)? 8. During the past 4 weeks, how much did pain interfere with your normal work (including work outside the home and housework)?

These questions are about how you have been feeling during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. How much of the time during the past 4 weeks... 9. Have you felt calm and peaceful?

EnumerationOption.description: A good bit of the time

AttributeDefinition.description: These questions are about how you have been feeling during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. How much of the time during the past 4 weeks... 10. Did you have a lot of energy?

EnumerationOption.description: A good bit of the time

AttributeDefinition.description: These questions are about how you have been feeling during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. How much of the time during the past 4 weeks... 11. Have you felt down-hearted and blue?

EnumerationOption.description: A good bit of the time

AttributeDefinition.description: These questions are about how you have been feeling during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. How much of the time during the past 4 weeks... 12. During the past 4 weeks, how much of the time has your physical health or emotional problems interfered with your social activities (like visiting friends, relatives, etc.)?
2. If I experience shortness of breath (dyspnoea) I stop and rest
3. If my difficulties to breath (dyspnoea) increase, I contact my doctor or nurse
4. If my legs swell more than usual, I contact my doctor or nurse
5. If I gain 2 or more kg in a week, I contact my doctor or nurse
6. I limit the amount of liquids I drink (less than 1.5 or 2 l/day)
7. I rest for a while during the day
8. If I feel more tired than usual, I contact my doctor or nurse
9. I have a low salt diet
10. I take my medication as prescribed
11. I get the flu vaccine every year
If I experience shortness of breath (dyspnoea) I stop and rest
If my difficulties to breath (dyspnoea) increase, I contact my doctor or nurse
If my coughing and mucus production (sputum) increase and mucus becomes nasty, I contact my doctor or nurse
I rest for a while during the day
If I feel more tired than usual, I contact my doctor or nurse
I take my medication as prescribed
I get the flu vaccine every year
Minutes of low level activity daily
Minutes of medium level activity daily
Minutes of high level activity daily
Max minutes without activity allowed daily
Minutes of low level activity daily
Minutes of medium level activity daily
Minutes of high level activity daily
Max minutes without activity allowed daily

EntityDefinition.description: Post Hospitalization Autocheck Health Status Prescription

AttributeDefinition.description: Validation of the prescription of the vital sings monitoring
Validation of the physical activity prescription
Validation of the education material proposed

EntityDefinition.description: Pre Hospitalization Anaemia Assessment And Management

AttributeDefinition.description: Blood Pressure Control Inside the correct values
1.In the area where you have pain, do you also have “pins and needles”, tingling or prickling sensations?

EnumerationOption.description: NO – I don’t get these sensations

AttributeDefinition.description: 2. Does the painful area change colour (perhaps look mottled or more red) when the pain is particularly bad?

EnumerationOption.description: NO – The pain does not affect the colour of my skin
YES – I have noticed that the pain does make my skin look different from normal.

AttributeDefinition.description: 3.Does your pain make the affected skin abnormally sensitive to touch? Getting unpleasant sensations or pain when lightly stroking the skin might describe this.

EnumerationOption.description: NO – The pain does not make my skin abnormally sensitive to touch.
YES – My skin in that area is particularly sensitive to touch.

AttributeDefinition.description: 4. Does your pain come on suddenly and in bursts for no apparent reason when you are completely still? Words like “electric shocks”, jumping and bursting might describe this.

EnumerationOption.description: NO – My pain doesn’t really feel like this.
YES – I get these sensations often.

AttributeDefinition.description: 5. In the area where you have pain, does your skin feel unusually hot like a burning pain?

EnumerationOption.description: NO – I don’t have burning pain
YES – I get burning pain often

AttributeDefinition.description: 5. In the area where you have pain, does your skin feel unusually hot like a burning pain?

EnumerationOption.description: The painful area feels no different from the non-painful area
I feel discomfort, like pins and needles, tingling or burning in the painful area that is different from the non-painful area.

AttributeDefinition.description: 7. Gently press on the painful area with your finger tip and then gently press in the same way onto a non-painful area (the same non-painful area that you chose in the last question). How does this feel in the painful area?

EnumerationOption.description: The painful area does not feel different from the non-painful area.
I feel numbness or tenderness in the painful area that is different from the non-painful area.

AttributeDefinition.description: Has patient's nutritional formation done during the hospitalization?
Has the caregiver's nutritional formation done during the hospitalization?
1.In the area where you have pain, do you also have “pins and needles”, tingling or prickling sensations?

EnumerationOption.description: NO – I don’t get these sensations

EnumerationOption.description: The painful area feels no different from the non-painful area

AttributeDefinition.description: 7. Gently press on the painful area with your finger tip and then gently press in the same way onto a non-painful area (the same non-painful area that you chose in the last question). How does this feel in the painful area?

EnumerationOption.description: The painful area does not feel different from the non-painful area.

AttributeDefinition.description: Has the patient done the rehabilitation exercicies?

AttributeDefinition.description: Has the patient done the rehabilitation exercicies?
